text: this is a story of mysterious
disappearing cuttlefish
he has camouflaged himself so completely
that no predator can find him this is
our missing cuttlefish he was last seen
swimming from fearsome predators when in
an instant he was gone of all the
thousands of animals that camouflage
themselves none can change their
appearance so quickly or dynamically as
the cuttlefish who disappears from view
as easily as you are I blink our eyes he
can change his color pattern and 3d skin
structure all in a fraction of a second
just as you and I have nerves that can
feel and move every inch of our body the
cuttlefish has nerves that can change
his body's color pattern by controlling
tiny organs called chromatophores he can
contract and relax the muscles around
each chromatophore thus increasing or
decreasing the amount of visible pigment
on his skin this cuttlefishes
chromatophores come in three colors dark
brown yellow and orange and there are
more than 20 million of them on his skin
in addition to changing his pigmentation
he can also change his 3d texture by
spiking out his body with tiny organs
called papillae
just imagine being able to flex a muscle
and your hand instantly becomes orange
and grows spikes but how does he fully
disappear from view when he remains
distinctly cuttlefish shaped one way is
to match his background by employing a
uniform pattern or a repeated pattern
known as model across this entire body
to blend in with the sand however if he
is hiding in high contrast areas he can
employ disruptive camouflage here he
dynamically creates false edges and non
repetitive patterns to confuse his
enemies therefore this cuttlefishes
disappearing act is not simply an act of
blending in but takes advantage of his
predators visual system to actively
confuse it now let's look again ah there
he is he was right in front of us all
along he seems to have matched his
backgrounds color yet cuttlefish can
only see one wavelength of light in
other words our cuttlefish is completely
colorblind how did he manage to mimic
color it appears that some aspects of
this mystery remain unsolved
you
Oh
